about.title: About Ganttleman
about.subtitle: We are committed to creating the most practical free online tools collection
about.description: Learn about Ganttleman - A platform providing free online tools including Gantt charts, JSON formatter, Base64 encoder/decoder and more.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.p1: In this digital age, we need to handle various tasks every day: formatting code, encoding/decoding data, compressing images, managing project schedules, and more. Although there are many tools available for these tasks, they often require downloads, account registration, or paid subscriptions.
mission.p2: Ganttleman was created to solve this problem. We provide a completely free, no-registration-required, ready-to-use collection of online tools. All tools run locally in your browser, ensuring your data security and privacy.

simple.title: Easy to Use
simple.description: Clean interface design, no learning required

free.title: Completely Free
free.description: All features are permanently free with no hidden costs

privacy.title: Privacy First
privacy.description: All processing is done locally to protect your data security

update.title: Continuous Updates
update.description: We constantly add new tools and improve existing features

why.title: Why Choose Ganttleman?
why.reason1: No software installation needed, just open your browser
why.reason2: No account registration or personal information required
why.reason3: Cross-platform support: Windows, Mac, Linux, and mobile devices
why.reason4: Fast loading, smooth operation, best user experience

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.metaDescription: Ganttleman Privacy Policy - Learn how we protect your personal data and privacy.

section1.title: Data Collection
section1.content: Ganttleman is committed to protecting your privacy. All our tools run locally in your browser and do not upload your data to our servers.

section2.title: Local Storage
section2.content: Some tools (such as Gantt charts) use the browser's LocalStorage feature to store your data, allowing you to continue using it on your next visit. This data is only stored on your device and we cannot access it.

section3.title: Cookies and Tracking
section3.content: We use Google Analytics to understand website usage and Google AdSense to display advertisements. These services may use Cookies to collect anonymous usage statistics.

section4.title: Third-Party Services
section4.intro: Our website uses the following third-party services:
section4.item2: Google Analytics - for analyzing website traffic
section4.outro: These services have their own privacy policies, and we recommend that you review them.

section5.title: Data Security
section5.content: Since we do not collect or store your personal data, there is no risk of data leakage. All processing is completed locally in your browser.

section6.title: Children's Privacy
section6.content: Our services are aimed at the general public and do not intentionally collect personal information from children under the age of 13.

section7.title: Policy Changes
section7.content: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. Any changes will be posted on this page and the 'Last Updated' date will be updated.

section8.title: Contact Us
section8.content: If you have any questions about this privacy policy, please contact us via email:

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.metaDescription: Ganttleman Terms of Service - Understand the terms and conditions for using our services.

section1.title: Service Description
section1.content: Ganttleman provides a collection of free online tools, including but not limited to Gantt charts, JSON formatting, Base64 encoding/decoding, image compression, and other features. All tools are free to use without registration.

section2.title: License to Use
section2.content: We grant you a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable right to use the services of this website. You agree to use this service only for lawful purposes and will not abuse this service in any way.

section3.title: Usage Restrictions
section3.item1: Attempt to disrupt or interfere with the normal operation of the website
section3.item2: Use automated tools to excessively access the website
section3.item3: Copy, modify, or distribute any part of the website (unless explicitly authorized)
section3.item4: Use the service for any illegal or unauthorized purpose

section4.title: Disclaimer
section4.content: This service is provided 'as is' without any express or implied warranties. We do not guarantee that the service will be uninterrupted, timely, secure, or error-free. We are not responsible for any data loss, errors, or damages arising from the use of this service.

section5.title: Limitation of Liability
section5.content: To the maximum extent permitted by law, Ganttleman and its developers shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages.

section6.title: Intellectual Property
section6.content: All content on this website, including but not limited to text, graphics, logos, icons, images, and software, is protected by copyright law and other intellectual property laws.

section7.title: Third-Party Links
section7.content: This website may contain links to third-party websites. We are not responsible for the content or practices of these websites.

section8.title: Terms Modification
section8.content: We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. Continued use of this service indicates your acceptance of the modified terms.

section9.title: Governing Law
section9.content: These terms are governed by the laws of the Republic of China (Taiwan), and any disputes shall be submitted to the jurisdiction of Taiwanese courts.

section10.title: Contact Information
section10.content: If you have any questions or concerns, please contact us:

jsonParser.title: JSON Formatter
jsonParser.description: Format, validate, and edit JSON data with support for visual editing, adding/removing nodes, and more

messages.parseSuccess: Parsed successfully! You can now edit the JSON data
messages.emptyState: Click the right arrow in the middle divider to start editing JSON

tips.title: Usage Tips
tips.tip1: Paste your JSON string into the left input box
tips.tip2: Click the 'Parse and Edit' button to parse JSON and enter visual editing mode
tips.tip3: In tree edit mode, you can directly modify values, convert types, add/remove nodes
tips.tip4: Arrays and objects can add new items/properties by clicking the '+' button
tips.tip5: Each node can be converted to different types (string, number, boolean, etc.) via dropdown menu
tips.tip6: In text view mode, click 'Minify' button to compress JSON (remove spaces and newlines)
tips.tip7: Drag the middle divider to resize the left and right panels
tips.tip8: After editing, click the 'Save' button to update the result back to the left input box
tips.tip9: All processing is completed locally in your browser and will not upload your data

base64.title: Multi-Format Encoder/Decoder
base64.description: Supports Base64, Hex, URL encoding and various hash algorithms

placeholder.output: Encoded result will be displayed here...

messages.decodeFailed: Decoding failed: Please ensure the input is valid
messages.irreversible: Hash algorithms are irreversible and can only be encoded

options.urlSafe: URL-Safe Mode (use - and _ instead of + and /)

info.description: Encoding is the process of converting data from one format to another. Different encoding methods are suitable for different scenarios, such as data transmission, storage, encryption, etc.
info.base64Desc: Uses 64 printable characters to represent binary data, commonly used in email attachments and data URLs
info.hexDesc: Uses 0-9 and A-F characters to represent binary data, commonly used in file hashes and color codes
info.urlDesc: Converts special characters to percent-encoded format for safe transmission in URLs
info.hashDesc: One-way hash algorithms (irreversible) for password storage and data integrity verification
info.useCase1: Base64: Embedding images in HTML/CSS, HTTP Basic Authentication
info.useCase2: Hex: File integrity verification (MD5/SHA checksums), color codes (#FF0000)
info.useCase3: URL Encode: Passing complex parameters in URLs, form data transmission
info.useCase4: Hash: Password storage, blockchain, digital signatures

imageCompressor.title: Image Compressor
imageCompressor.description: Compress images online while maintaining good quality, supports JPG, PNG, WebP formats

tips.title: Usage Tips
tips.tip1: Adjust the quality slider to control compression level - lower values mean smaller file size but reduced quality
tips.tip2: Recommended quality setting is between 70-85% for a good balance between file size and quality
tips.tip3: Compressed image format is JPEG, suitable for photos
tips.tip4: All processing is completed locally in your browser and will not upload your images

crypto.title: Encryption/Decryption Tool
crypto.description: Secure text encryption and decryption with multiple algorithms

placeholder.output: Encrypted result will be displayed here...
placeholder.key: Enter hex key or click generate
placeholder.iv: Enter hex IV or click generate
placeholder.publicKey: Paste public key or click generate to create a key pair
placeholder.privateKey: Paste private key or click generate to create a key pair

messages.decryptFailed: Decryption failed: Please check your key, IV, and encrypted text
messages.emptyPublicKey: Please enter or generate a public key
messages.emptyPrivateKey: Please enter or generate a private key
messages.gcmWarning: Note: GCM mode is simulated using CTR mode in this implementation. For production use, consider using Web Crypto API directly.

crypto.warning: IMPORTANT: Save your key and IV securely! Without them, you cannot decrypt your data. All encryption is performed locally in your browser.
crypto.rsaWarning: IMPORTANT: Save your private key securely! Anyone with your private key can decrypt messages encrypted with your public key. You can safely share your public key. All operations are performed locally in your browser.
crypto.gcmInfo: GCM (Galois/Counter Mode) is the recommended mode for AES. It provides authenticated encryption with associated data (AEAD), ensuring both confidentiality and integrity.

info.title: What is Encryption?
info.description: Encryption is the process of converting readable text into unreadable ciphertext using a secret key. Only those with the correct key can decrypt and read the original text.
info.aesDesc: Advanced Encryption Standard, the most widely used and secure symmetric encryption algorithm (256-bit key)
info.desDesc: Data Encryption Standard, an older algorithm now considered less secure. 3DES offers improved security
info.rc4Desc: Stream cipher, fast but has known vulnerabilities. Not recommended for sensitive data
info.rabbitDesc: High-speed stream cipher, offering good security and performance
info.gcmDesc: Galois/Counter Mode - Recommended! Provides authenticated encryption (AEAD), ensuring both confidentiality and integrity
info.cbcDesc: Cipher Block Chaining - Widely used, requires IV, provides good security
info.ecbDesc: Electronic Codebook - Simple but least secure, not recommended for production use
info.otherModes: CFB, OFB, CTR: Various modes offering different security and performance characteristics
info.rsaDescription: RSA is an asymmetric encryption algorithm that uses a pair of keys (public and private). Messages encrypted with the public key can only be decrypted with the corresponding private key.
info.rsaFeature1Desc: Generate a public key (for encryption) and private key (for decryption) pair
info.rsaFeature2Desc: You can safely share your public key - others use it to encrypt messages only you can decrypt
info.rsaFeature3Desc: 2048-bit provides good security, 4096-bit provides even stronger protection but is slower

clearDialog.content: Are you sure you want to clear all data? This will delete all Sprints, Members, and Tasks and cannot be undone.

ganttGuide.title: Gantt Chart User Guide
ganttGuide.subtitle: Complete feature guide and usage tips
ganttGuide.description: Learn how to use Ganttleman's Resource Gantt Chart tool for team task management and scheduling.

whatIs.title: What is a Gantt Chart?
whatIs.p1: A Gantt chart is a project management tool that displays project schedules in a bar chart format. Invented by Henry Gantt in the 1910s, it remains one of the most popular project management visualization tools today.
whatIs.p2: In Ganttleman's Resource Gantt Chart, we apply the traditional Gantt chart concept to team resource allocation. Each Member corresponds to a row, different time periods (Sprints) correspond to columns, and Task cards are placed at the intersection of members and sprints.
whatIs.p3: This visualization allows you to see at a glance: which members are responsible for which tasks during what time period, whether the team's workload is balanced, and whether there are resource conflicts.

drag.title: Drag & Drop
drag.description: Directly drag task cards to different members or time periods, intuitive and simple

sprint.title: Sprint Management
sprint.description: Create multiple Sprint time periods, set start and end dates

member.title: Member Management
member.description: Add team members, adjust order, clearly track everyone's tasks

color.title: Color Coding
color.description: Set colors for tasks to quickly distinguish different types or priorities

export.title: Export Functions
export.description: Export as PNG, PDF or JSON format for easy sharing and backup

storage.title: Local Storage
storage.description: Automatically saves to browser, loads automatically on next visit

step1.title: 1. Create Sprints
step1.description: Click the '+ Add' button at the top to create Sprints (time periods). Each Sprint can have a name, start date, and end date. You can create multiple Sprints to plan different phases of work, such as 'Week 1', 'Week 2', etc.

step2.title: 2. Add Members
step2.description: Click the '+ Add' button on the left to add team members. After entering a member name, they will appear in the left list. You can drag members to adjust their order or use the right-click menu to insert new members at specific positions.

step3.title: 3. Create Tasks
step3.description: Click the '+' button in any cell, or drag task cards from the Task Storage on the right to the corresponding member and Sprint intersection. Each task can have a name, color, and hyperlink. You can also duplicate tasks and set links to related documents or URLs.

step4.title: 4. Adjust & Export
step4.description: Drag task cards to reassign them to different members or move them to different time periods. After planning, use the toolbar's export function to export the Gantt chart as an image (PNG), PDF, or JSON format for easy sharing with the team or archiving.

tips.title: Advanced Tips
tips.tip1: Use colors to distinguish task types: e.g., red for urgent tasks, blue for development tasks, green for testing tasks
tips.tip2: Set hyperlinks for tasks: Cmd/Ctrl + Click to quickly open related documents, Jira tickets, or other references
tips.tip3: Use Task Storage: Tasks that you're unsure about assigning can be temporarily placed in Storage, then dragged to the appropriate position later
tips.tip4: Regularly export JSON backups: Export the entire project as a JSON file for version backup or syncing between different computers
tips.tip5: Make good use of Undo/Redo: Supports Cmd+Z for undo and Cmd+Shift+Z for redo, so don't worry about mistakes

project.title: Project Planning
project.description: Plan various phases of software development projects and assign team member tasks

team.title: Team Collaboration
team.description: Visualize team member work allocation to ensure workload balance

sprint.title: Agile Development
sprint.description: Manage Scrum Sprint task allocation and progress tracking

security.title: Data Security
security.p1: All data is stored locally in your browser (LocalStorage) and is never uploaded to any server. This means your project information is completely private and only accessible to you.
security.p2: We recommend regularly using the 'Export JSON' function to backup your data in case browser data is cleared. Exported JSON files can be imported at any time to restore your project content.

q1.question: Is Ganttleman free?
q1.answer: Yes, Ganttleman is completely free. All features can be used without limitations, no registration or payment required.

q2.question: Do I need to register an account?
q2.answer: No. We don't require registration and don't collect your personal information. All tools can be used directly.

q3.question: Is my data safe?
q3.answer: Very safe. All tools run locally in your browser, and data is not uploaded to our servers. Gantt chart data is stored in the browser's LocalStorage and only you can access it.

q4.question: Which browsers are supported?
q4.answer: Ganttleman supports all modern browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, etc. We recommend using the latest version of your browser for the best experience.

q1.question: How do I backup my Gantt chart data?
q1.answer: Click the 'Export JSON' button in the toolbar to export the entire project as a JSON file. We recommend regular backups in case browser data is cleared.

q2.question: Can I sync data between different computers?
q2.answer: Since data is stored locally in the browser, automatic syncing is not available. However, you can use 'Export JSON' and 'Import JSON' functions to manually transfer data between different computers.

q3.question: How do I share the Gantt chart with my team?
q3.answer: You can use 'Export PNG' or 'Export PDF' functions to export the Gantt chart as an image or PDF file, then share it with team members via email, Slack, or other methods. The PDF format also supports clickable hyperlinks.

q4.question: What are task card links for?
q4.answer: You can set hyperlinks for tasks to link to related documents, Jira tickets, GitHub issues, or other references. Use Cmd/Ctrl + Click to quickly open links. When exported as PDF, these links are preserved and clickable.

q5.question: What if I accidentally delete data?
q5.answer: You can use Cmd+Z (Mac) or Ctrl+Z (Windows) to undo operations. Ganttleman supports multi-step Undo/Redo functionality. If you've already closed the page, you'll need to restore from a previously exported JSON backup.

q1.question: Why did my Gantt chart disappear after clearing browser data?
q1.answer: Gantt chart data is stored in the browser's LocalStorage. If you clear browser data (including site data, cookies, etc.), the Gantt chart data will also be deleted. This is why we recommend regularly exporting JSON backups.

q2.question: Can I use it on mobile?
q2.answer: Yes, but the Gantt chart tool works better on computers. Mobile screens are smaller and dragging operations are less convenient. Other tools like JSON formatter, Base64 encoder, etc. work perfectly fine on mobile.

q3.question: What if I encounter problems or bugs?
q3.answer: If you encounter any issues or find bugs, please contact us through the contact information in the footer. We will address and fix issues as soon as possible.

q1.question: Does the JSON formatter validate syntax?
q1.answer: Yes, when you click the 'Parse and Edit' button, the tool automatically validates JSON syntax. If there are errors, it will display error messages and error locations.

q2.question: Does image compression reduce quality?
q2.answer: There will be some quality loss, but it's usually imperceptible to the naked eye. You can adjust the compression quality slider to control the compression level. We recommend setting it between 70-85% for a good balance between file size and quality.

q3.question: Is the encryption tool secure?
q3.answer: All encryption operations are performed locally in your browser, and keys and data are not uploaded to servers. However, you must keep your keys safe, as data cannot be decrypted without them. This tool is suitable for general purposes; for extremely sensitive data, we recommend using professional encryption software.

contact.title: Have other questions?
contact.description: If your question is not listed here or you need more help, feel free to contact us via email.
